content: It doesn't look like the https://github.com/FHIR/sample-ig/blob/master/input/pagecontent/StructureDefinition-ext-myExtension-intro.md is rendered correctly on http://build.fhir.org/ig/FHIR/sample-ig/StructureDefinition-ext-myExtension.html @Lloyd McKenzie
I hate markdown :( @Eric Haas - thoughts on what the source should look like?

the raw md is very simple:

a header and a paragraph...

### Introduction
Introductory guidance on myExtension

should look like this...

Introduction

Introductory guidance on myExtension

but is rendering like this...

### Introduction Introductory guidance on myExtension

My theory is because of the markdownify filter being used in Jekyll, but I haven't had a chance to work on it and create a CR. I will be converting Da Vince DEQM to the templates and then I can chase it down later today....
funny - it works locally for me ;) also - it wouldn't hurt to repeat what the file pattern is for notes and intro files on https://build.fhir.org/ig/FHIR/ig-guidance/using-templates.html#page-files
@Lloyd McKenzie this is an issue in the base template - include doesn't process .md. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/41966638/jekyll-on-github-pages-include-markdown-in-another-markdown-file
